title: The Polytope Compression Hypothesis: Measuring Perceptual Efficiency
topic_summary: A novel dimensionless metric that quantifies how many behaviorally discriminable color experiences organisms extract per unit of available experiential complexity, using Hoffman's Markov polytope formalism. Shows inverse scaling across species, revealing two regimes of color vision processing.
target_audience: Researchers in vision science, sensory ecology, consciousness studies, and comparative psychophysics. Assumes familiarity with basic color vision concepts but introduces the Markov polytope framework.
